metadata.synopsis: After meeting Karlach and choosing whether to keep her alive or kill her, Mizora appears in camp to turn Wyll into a devil or reward him with a new power.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Initiate Karlach's recruitment with Wyll in party or as avatar, then visit camp once scene is over.

22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll enters the camp, and is taken aback. A diabolical circle has begun to outline itself on the ground in front of him.

36.speaker: Mizora
36.text: I prefer 'advocate'. Has a nice ring to it.

165.speaker: Mizora
165.text: You've been a bad boy, Wyll. I'd say your leash needs a yank.
165.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mizora makes a yanking motion in Wyll's direction as if pulling a leash when saying 'yank.' Wyll holds his hands to his throat.

58.speaker: Mizora
58.text: We had a deal. But Karlach's still breathing.

49.speaker: Mizora
49.text: And a good handler knows when her pup needs correction. To wit:

187.speaker: Wyll
187.text: Do whatever you want with me. But leave my friends alone.

45.speaker: Mizora
45.text: Don't worry. A good handler disciplines only her own pets. To wit:

101.speaker: Narrator
101.text: *You burn in the fires of Avernus; the lightning storms of Dis strike your flesh. Your soul passes through each layer of the Hells, gaining their essence - and their torment.*
101.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fire roars around Wyll. For a moment he is hidden behind the flames

63.speaker: Wyll
63.text: By the gods, what have you done to me?

46.speaker: Wyll
46.text: Interesting. I've never grown horns before...

32.speaker: Mizora
32.text: And that's not the half of it.

18.speaker: Mizora
18.text: Karlach. Keep an eye on him, would you?

121.speaker: Mizora
121.text: I'll be keeping mine on you.

83.speaker: Mizora
83.text: Oh - and Wyll? Don't forget. Our pact still stands. Ta-ta!

2.speaker: Mizora
2.text: And do mind your messes, Wyll. I won't always be there to clean them up.

106.speaker: Wyll
106.text: A devil, huh? Not much of a punishment - more like a favour.

125.speaker: Mizora
125.text: A matter of perspective, I'm sure you'll agree.

62.speaker: Wyll
62.text: Do your worst. I'm not afraid of you.

171.speaker: Wyll
171.text: You said my targets were monsters. But Karlach's no monster.

145.speaker: Mizora
145.text: How precious. The little pupster's found his bark.

123.speaker: Mizora
123.text: You've been defiant - and defiance requires discipline. To wit:

109.speaker: Wyll
109.text: I'm sorry. I should have obeyed. It won't happen again.

65.speaker: Mizora
65.text: What's done is done, Wyll. And a defiant pup needs discipline. To wit:

16.speaker: Wyll
16.text: What if I kill Karlach now? Would that make you happy?

80.speaker: Mizora
80.text: That ship has long sailed the Styx, Wyll. A defiant pup pays the price. To wit:

48.speaker: Mizora
48.text: Catch up. Give you a pat.

56.speaker: Mizora
56.text: After all - you've been a very good boy.

77.speaker: Mizora
77.text: I say fetch, and you fetch. I say kill a fugitive tiefling, and -

164.speaker: Mizora
164.text: Well. I can trust it'll get done.

138.speaker: Wyll
138.text: I'm supposed to be hunting devils, not refugees.

117.speaker: Mizora
117.text: How precious. The little pupster's found his bark.

19.speaker: Mizora
19.text: A nice new power should keep you muzzled.

7.speaker: Narrator
7.text: *Somewhere deep inside, a spark is ignited. You are the Hells' fires made flesh.*
7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fire roars around Wyll. For a moment he is hidden behind the flames

71.speaker: Wyll
71.text: I can't accept your reward. I killed an innocent.

148.speaker: Wyll
148.text: Come on. I've earned more than just the one power.

38.speaker: Mizora
38.text: Hush, pup. A good warlock knows when not to push his luck.

92.speaker: Wyll
92.text: Great. I look forward to my next assignment.

179.speaker: Wyll
179.text: I did what you asked. It's time for my reward.

21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player enters the camp, and is taken aback. A diabolical circle has begun to outline itself on the ground in front of Wyll.

93.context: CinematicNodeContext: The diabolical circle completes itself, creating a portal from the Hells. Mizora rises from it and spreads her wings wide. The circle disappears.

66.speaker: Mizora
66.context: NodeContext: Grinning. With the voice of a pet owner who caught her dog pooping on the carpet.

60.speaker: Mizora
60.text: And you know what happens when you're naughty.

161.speaker: Karlach
161.text: Gods damn it. Anyone but her.
161.context: NodeContext: Very unhappy to see Mizora her. Karlach's first remark on Mizora; best if it has an air of Mizora's power, a slight feeling of fear.

51.speaker: Narrator
51.text: *You know this devil. Mizora, one of Zariel's servants, and a powerful devil in her own regard.*

153.speaker: Player
153.text: Just who in the Nine Hells are you?

9.speaker: Mizora
9.text: Wyll, you absolute stinker! You kept me a secret? Time to let the hellcat out of the bag.
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to Wyll. So *very* patronising.

20.speaker: Mizora
20.text: Call me Mizora. I'm Wyll's patron, the fount of his power. My pet's been unruly -

73.speaker: Mizora
73.text: - and his leash needs a yank.
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mizora makes a yanking motion in Wyll's direction as if pulling a leash when saying 'yank.' Wyll holds his hands to his throat.

105.speaker: Mizora
105.text: We had a deal, Wyll. But Karlach's still breathing.

142.speaker: Karlach
142.text: I've taken more pleasant shits than you, Mizora, and at least those can be buried after.

54.speaker: Mizora
54.text: That's no kind of talk for a lady. By the way, Karlach -

100.speaker: Wyll
100.text: You told me devils only. She's - a tiefling. Not a monster.
100.context: NodeContext: Speaking as if being choked

31.speaker: Mizora
31.text: How precious. The little pupster's found his bark.

143.speaker: Mizora
143.text: Karlach meets the criteria by virtue of having no heart.

181.speaker: Mizora
181.text: Karlach meets the criteria, pet. Trust me on this.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: Get to the point, devil. What do you want?

98.speaker: Mizora
98.text: The point? Oh, yes - thanks for the reminder.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: If we kill Karlach now, will that get rid of you?

169.speaker: Mizora
169.text: Now? Too late, flower. You'll never be rid of me.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: You better not lay a damned finger on Karlach.

47.speaker: Mizora
47.text: Don't you worry - that ship has long sailed the Styx. But a defiant pup must still pay his price. To wit:

173.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mizora makes a dramatic 'wiping' motion with her hands. Hellish magic fills the air.

8.speaker: Narrator
8.text: *Wyll burns in the fires of Avernus; the lightning storms of Dis strike his flesh. His soul passes through each layer of the Hells, gaining their essence - and their torment.*
8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fire roars around Wyll. For a moment he is hidden behind the flames

33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll looks at himsel in horror as he begins to change form. He turns to a horrific devil. When it is done, he stares at himself in disbelief.

104.speaker: Wyll
104.text: What the hells have you done?

131.speaker: Mizora
131.text: A promise broken, a price paid. You know the terms.

170.speaker: Mizora
170.text: Get used to the new form, pet - there's no going back. Some magic, even I can't undo.

11.speaker: Mizora
11.text: Now. Let's see how the Frontiers fare without their precious Blade.

133.speaker: Mizora
133.text: Karlach. Keep an eye on him, would you?

116.speaker: Mizora
116.text: I'll be keeping mine on you.

78.speaker: Mizora
78.text: Keep an eye on him, will you?

82.speaker: Mizora
82.text: I'll be keeping mine on you.

128.speaker: Mizora
128.text: Oh - and Wyll? Don't forget. Our pact still stands. Ta-ta!

176.context: CinematicNodeContext: The diabolical circle draws itself under Mizora's feet and she sinks into the hells. The circle dissipates behind her.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: Blast it all, Wyll. Why didn't you tell me about her?

137.speaker: Mizora
137.text: He's the Blade of Frontiers. 'Devil's plaything' just doesn't have the same ring.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: I've heard enough. You're not leaving this place alive.

135.speaker: Mizora
135.text: Kill me? I wouldn't recommend it. I die, and Wyll turns to a lemure and gets sucked right down to the Hells.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Why don't you fuck all the way off, Mizora?

10.speaker: Mizora
10.text: That's no kind of talk for a lady, Karlach.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Well, well. Aren't you a luscious thing?

110.speaker: Mizora
110.text: You flatterer. Why, if I had a warm heart, I'm sure it would be skipping.

175.speaker: Player
175.text: Godsdamned devil. Get out of my camp!

108.speaker: Mizora
108.text: Now? But I'm just getting comfy.
108.context: NodeContext: Oh so patronising and slippery

99.speaker: Mizora
99.text: Call me Mizora. I'm Wyll's patron, the fount of his power. My pet's been unruly -

50.speaker: Mizora
50.text: I prefer 'advocate'. Has a nice ring to it.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: That's a nice set of wings. Let me guess: Wyll's patron?

28.speaker: Mizora
28.text: Handler's the word, if it's all the same.

156.speaker: Mizora
156.text: Wyll, buddy. I thought it was time I drop by the doghouse.
156.context: NodeContext: Grinning, and so very condescending.

27.speaker: Wyll
27.context: NodeContext: Not exactly excited to see Mizora after her sudden appearance in the cmap

107.speaker: Mizora
107.text: You haven't introduced me to your friends. Where are your manners?

136.speaker: Player
136.text: Call me [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. Now what in the Nine Hells is going on?

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Call me [GEN_PlayerName2_85df4a15-4d9b-4f68-0512-d104305d8dac]. Now what in the Nine Hells is going on?

158.speaker: Mizora
158.text: Wyll, you absolute stinker! You kept me a secret? Time to let the hellcat out of the bag.

167.speaker: Player
167.text: Well, well. Aren't you a luscious thing?

14.speaker: Mizora
14.text: You flatterer. Why, if I had a heart, I'm sure it would be skipping.

79.speaker: Mizora
79.text: Call me Mizora. I'm Wyll's patron, the fount of his power. Your warlock friend is my puppy -

84.speaker: Mizora
84.text: - and he's been a very good boy.
84.context: NodeContext: Talking about Wyll like you'd talk about a dog.

119.speaker: Mizora
119.text: I say fetch, and he'll fetch. I say kill a fugitive tiefling, and -

185.speaker: Mizora
185.text: Well. I don't need to tell you.

30.speaker: Wyll
30.text: You said devils only. She was a tiefling, not a monster.
30.context: NodeContext: Upset. He's been lied to.

75.speaker: Mizora
75.text: Clause G, Section Nine: 'Targets shall be limited to the infernal, the demonic, the heartless, and the soulless.'

3.speaker: Mizora
3.text: Cheer up, buttercup. Karlach had no heart. You did the world a favour.

29.speaker: Mizora
29.text: More to the point, you obeyed.

129.speaker: Player
129.text: Get on with it, devil. What do you want?

112.speaker: Player
112.text: Damn it all, Wyll. Why didn't you tell me about her?

118.speaker: Player
118.text: I've heard enough. You're not leaving this place alive.

42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mizora makes a dramatic 'wiping' motion with her hands. Hellish magic fills the air.

40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Power surges through Wyll. He rises into the air, and then drops to his feet. He has been gifted a new devilish power.InternalNodeContext: Wyll gets a new power

74.speaker: Mizora
74.text: Always a pleasure. Shame that tadpole's gone and pissed on your party.

178.speaker: Mizora
178.text: But I'll be damned if it goes pissing on mine.

134.speaker: Mizora
134.text: I've got some errands to do - but don't you fret much, pup. I'll be back in three shakes of your tail.

146.speaker: Player
146.text: Godsdamned devil. Get out of my camp!

86.speaker: Mizora
86.text: Now? But I'm just getting comfy.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: That's a nice set of wings. Let me guess: Wyll's patron?

174.speaker: Mizora
174.text: Handler's the word, if it's all the same. Call me Mizora - your dear friend Wyll is my little puppy -

61.speaker: Mizora
61.text: You haven't introduced me to your friend. Where are your manners?
